meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to dive into the not-so-awesomely received LEGO Movie 2 Videogame!

As a seasoned grok (see what I did there?) game reviewer, I'm here to give you the lowdown on this film tie-in. And let me tell you, it's been a real treat... said no one ever.

I've scoured the interwebs for some of the most "illuminating" reviews out there (wink), and boy, do they have some harsh words to say about this game! COGconnected thinks it's just a cash grab, Eurogamer Italy says it's got no appeal, and Metro GameCentral... well, let's just say they're not fans of the "nastiness" that is LEGO Movie 2 Videogame.

But don't worry, I'm here to balance things out! After all, every cloud has a silver lining (or in this case, a poorly executed co-op mechanic). 3DJuegos seems to think there's some interesting sandbox gameplay hiding beneath the surface. And Meristation? They're just happy it's easy enough for kids to enjoy!

So, what does it mean when everything is not awesome? Is LEGO Movie 2 Videogame a one-trick pony that promises the world but delivers mediocrity? Should you bother investing your hard-earned cash in this game?

Well, kiddos and seasoned gamers alike, let me put it this way: if you're looking for a LEGO experience that's anything less than subpar (ahem), I'd recommend taking a gander at some of the other franchise games. The DC Super-Villains or Harry Potter re-releases might be more up your alley.

But hey, who knows? You might just find yourself loving this game despite its many flaws! After all, it's all about having fun... and not getting too salty about a mediocre experience (that's me talking, of course!).

Stay groovy, folks!
